author: Charlie Nash
description: Facebook is appealing an order to impose Austria's social media laws against hate speech on the platform worldwide.
title: Facebook to Appeal Court Ruling Imposing Austria's 'Hate Speech' Ban Globally - Breitbart

author: Jon Stone
description: Election rules are failing to keep pace with rapid changes in technology, allowing political parties to spend millions of pounds on locally targeted Facebook adverts with national campaign funds, experts have warned.
title: How outdated election rules let parties 'buy' marginal seats using Facebook

author: Ashley Cowburn
description: Jeremy Corbyn ambushed Theresa May as she appeared on Facebook Live, issuing a direct challenge to the Prime Minister to take part in televised debates before the general election. Ms May, however, dismissed the Labour leader’s question that he left on the livestream, claiming it would be more important during the next four weeks before polling day to take questions directly from voters.
title: The picture that sums up how Theresa May's Facebook live went

author: Gilles Guirand
description:
At the conclusion of January, Facebook had officially shuttered Parse, disabling the API on an app by app basis. 

As a Backend as a Service (BaaS) product, the development platform ...
title: What to consider when parsing through your Parse alternatives

author: Adi Robertson
description: Games company ZeniMax, which successfully sued Facebook-owned Oculus for $500 million earlier this year, has filed a new lawsuit over Samsung’s Gear VR headset. The suit alleges that Samsung...
title: ZeniMax is suing Samsung after winning its case against Oculus
